DataElement.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Edema Intervention Specify
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the free text field to specify the other intervention for extremity edema.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Kaposi Sarcoma Related Limb Edema Interventions
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an intervention (an action intended to alter the course of a pathologic process) for Kaposi Sarcoma (a malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells) related limb (a body region referring to an upper or lower extremity) edema (pathological transudate within one or more tissues).

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin however, it may also occur internally.  It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).:Related; connected or associated.:A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.:Pathological transudate within one or more tissues.(FMA)

Concepts.definition: A malignant neoplasm characterized by a vascular proliferation which usually contains blunt endothelial cells. Erythrocyte extravasation and hemosiderin deposition are frequently present. The most frequent site of involvement is the skin; however it may also occur internally. It generally develops in people with compromised immune systems including those with acquired immune deficiency syndrome (AIDS).
A state of connectedness between people, objects, or events; to be associated or connected with something.
A body region referring to an upper or lower extremity.
Accumulation of an excessive amount of fluid in cells or intercellular tissues.

Property.preferredDefinition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: An action or ministration that produces an effect or that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the free-text field to specify the therapy administered.
